goal_name: A dynamic public sector with good governance principles and strong institutions delivering the support and services expected by all citizens of Vanuatu
target_name: Enact political reforms that promote stability, accountability, constituency representation and civic engagement
indicator_name: Proportion of eligible population reporting to have voted in last election
GoalDescription: A dynamic public sector with good governance principles and strong institutions delivering the support and services expected by all citizens of Vanuatu
PolicyObjectiveDescription: Enact political reforms that promote stability, accountability, constituency representation and civic engagement
IndicatorDescription: Proportion of eligible population reporting to have voted in last election
ComputationMethod: Collect total number of eligible voters who voted in the last election through the electoral office biometric voters registration systems. Approved through MoA’s & MoU’s.
Concept: Voters turnout will indicate whether or not political reforms are being implemented to promote stability accountability, constituency representation and civic engagement.
Definition: Vote turnout is the percentage of eligible voters who cast a ballot in an election. Eligibility varies by country, and the voting-eligible population should not be confused with the total adult population.
Rationale: To depict the total number of eligible voters that voted in the last election in relation to the political reforms that are already put in placed and whether it is proactive or not.
graph_title: Proportion of eligible population reporting to have voted in last election
